line-9: Join Our Team as Network Technical Head Track! At Network Rail, we're more than just a railway infrastructure operator - we're a passionate team dedicated to crafting safe, reliable, and efficient transportation for people and goods. We take pride in supporting our country's economic prosperity and sustainable future. Now, we're looking for a Network Technical Head on a permanent basis, to lead our track engineering asset in Milton Keynes. If you're ready to make a significant impact and be a part of our inclusive and dynamic organisation, keep reading!
line-11: What Will You Be Doing? As our Network Technical Head Track, your role will be diverse and engaging. You'll have the opportunity to: Shape and maintain company policy and technical strategies for track engineering, collaborating with other teams to achieve our strategic objectives. Be the technical authority for track engineering, ensuring compliance with our safety management system. Provide professional leadership to engineers throughout the company, mentoring and challenging them to excel in their field. Influence the development of regulations and standards, safeguarding Network Rail's interests and reflecting them in our documentation. Represent our track engineering interests with internal and external customers, including safety and financial regulators. Develop and oversee track engineering technical rules, controls, specifications, procedures, and good practice guides. Define track engineering design principles to drive innovation and excellence. Establish and manage the track engineering assurance regime, advising the Board on business performance. Play a key role in investigating safety and performance failures, implementing technical recommendations. Who Are We Looking For? To excel in this role, you should possess the following qualifications and qualities: Chartered Engineer or equivalent professional engineering qualification (Level 7). Recognised leadership capabilities in track engineering. Strong understanding of asset management strategies. Extensive experience in managing engineering processes, assets, and products. Extensive knowledge of engineering systems, standards, and process integrity. Previous experience in driving engineering improvements in safety-critical or public-facing industries. Ability to encourage and empower others. Resilience to prioritise multiple engineering issues simultaneously. For a comprehensive list of the role's key accountabilities, as well as essential and desirable criteria, please click apply and you will be redirected to the Network Rail external website where you can find the Network Rail job description dedicated to this advert. If you're ready to tackle phenomenal opportunity, apply now! #LI-MH1
